content.question: Which statement correctly explains why the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi></math> value of sample <math alttext="3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is the greatest?

choices.label: It has the smallest value of <math alttext="the molar concentration of H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mpadded><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mpadded></mpadded></math>.

It has the smallest value of <math alttext="the molar concentration of O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msup><mi>OH</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>.
It has the weakest conjugate base.

content.answer: It has the smallest value of <math alttext="the molar concentration of H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mpadded><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mpadded></mpadded></math>.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
